references.paper_title: Global explainability of GNNs via logic combination of learned concepts
references.reason: This paper is the closest related work to the proposed method, offering a global GNN explainer but having limitations in concept mining and interpretability that the current work addresses.

references.paper_title: Gnnexplainer: Generating explanations for graph neural networks
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduces the GNNExplainer, a widely used instance-level explainer that GRAPHTRAIL builds upon and improves upon to generate global explanations.

references.paper_title: A unified approach to interpreting model predictions
references.reason: This paper introduces the SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) values, a crucial component of GRAPHTRAIL's concept mining methodology that quantifies the contribution of each subgraph.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This seminal paper introduces graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a foundational GNN architecture whose predictions GRAPHTRAIL aims to explain.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This important paper introduces a framework for inductive representation learning on graphs, which is relevant to GRAPHTRAIL's applicability to various GNN architectures.
